author: Reuters Editorial
title: Senate sets initial votes in immigration debate
text:
The U.S. Senate was set to begin voting at 2:30 p.m. (1930 GMT) on a series of immigration bills aimed at giving legal protections to young undocumented immigrants.
Only one of the four measures has won the support of the Trump administration and in the run-up to the vote senators were not expressing confidence that any of the “Dreamer” bills would win enough votes to clear procedural hurdles.
Reporting By Richard Cowan and Susan Cornwell; Editing by Frances Kerry
